verses.text: 更重的刑罰以色列人哪！要聽耶和華攻擊你們的這些話，就是攻擊他從埃及地領上來的以色列全家，說：

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
Implies leading from a lower to higher place or status.

verses.text: 「地上萬族中，我只揀選了你；因此，我必追討你們的一切罪。」

words.note: Often used in the Bible to mean 'all peoples' or 'all nations'.
A common biblical term for God's selection.
Implies seeking out and bringing to account.

verses.text: 二人如果沒有約定，怎會同行呢？
先知的使命獅子如果不是捕獲獵物，怎會在林中吼叫？少壯獅子如果沒有捕獲甚麼，怎會在洞中咆哮呢？

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.
Refers to a young, vigorous stage of life.
Describes a fierce, angry roar.

verses.text: 如果沒有餌，雀鳥怎會掉在地上的網羅中？網羅如果沒有捕獲雀鳥，怎會從地上翻起呢？

words.note: Refers generally to small birds or sparrows.
Often used metaphorically for temptation or peril.
Often used metaphorically for temptation or peril.
Refers generally to small birds or sparrows.
Describes a sudden upward movement, like a trap snapping shut.

verses.text: 城中如果吹起號角，居民怎會不驚慌呢？災禍如果臨到某城，不是耶和華所降的嗎？

words.note: Indicates the agent or means of an action.

verses.text: 如果主耶和華不先把計劃向他的僕人眾先知顯示，他就不會作任何事。

words.note: Often refers to God in a religious context.
Used to bring the object before the verb.
Often refers to God's servants in religious texts.
Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.

verses.text: 獅子吼叫，誰不害怕；主耶和華宣告，誰敢不代他傳話？

words.note: Often refers to God in a religious context.
Often used for formal or divine proclamations.

verses.text: 犯罪的結果要向亞實突和埃及的堡壘宣告：「你們要在撒瑪利亞山上聚集；觀看城裡極大的騷亂和城中的暴虐。」

words.note: Common in legal and religious contexts.
Often used for formal or divine proclamations.

verses.text: 「這些人不知道怎樣行正直的事，只管在他們的堡壘中積聚暴行和欺壓。」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Often used in moral or ethical contexts.
Often used for formal or divine proclamations.

verses.text: 因此，主耶和華這樣說：「敵人必圍攻這地，使你們的勢力傾覆，搶掠你們的堡壘。」

words.note: Refers to God
Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God

verses.text: 耶和華這樣說：「牧人從獅子口中，只能奪回一雙羊腿和一角耳朵；住在撒瑪利亞的以色列人獲救也是這樣，他們只剩下一角床榻，半邊褥子（「他們只剩下一角床榻，半邊褥子」，這句原文意義不詳，或譯：「他們躺臥在華麗的床上，睡在鋪上繡花毯子的榻上」）。

words.note: Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God

breakdown.m: measure word for flowers/clouds, here suffix

words.note: Transliteration of a biblical place name
People of Israel

words.definition: to be rescued, to be saved
to be left over, to remain

words.note: Refers to a sleeping or reclining surface

words.definition: to be left over, to remain

words.note: Refers to a sleeping or reclining surface
Acts as a locative suffix
Refers to a low bed or couch for reclining
Acts as a locative suffix

verses.text: 你們要聽，要向雅各家作證。（這是主耶和華萬軍之 神的宣告。）

words.note: Refers to the descendants of Jacob, i.e., the people of Israel.
Refers to God
Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God
Part of the title 'Lord of Hosts'
Connects '萬軍' to '神', similar to 'of'
Capitalized to refer to the supreme deity

verses.text: 我追討以色列的悖逆時，必要懲罰伯特利的祭壇；壇角必砍下，跌落在地。

words.note: Refers to the nation of Israel
Often used in religious or formal contexts
Transliteration of a biblical place name

words.definition: to cut off, to chop down

verses.text: 我必毀壞冬天和夏天的別墅，用象牙裝飾的房子必破爛，宏偉的樓宇必歸於無有。」這是耶和華的宣告。

words.definition: to return to, to result in

words.note: Implies complete destruction
Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God
